Package com.github.thorbenkuck.netcom2.annotations

This package contains all non-rmi annotations.

See: Description

  • Annotation Types Summary 
    Annotation Type Description
    APILevel
    This shows, that an annotated Method is exposed to be used only by the implementing developer.
    Asynchronous
    This annotation is used to signal, that the annotated method is executing some procedure within another Thread.
    Experimental
    Shows that this annotated class is not yet tested thoroughly.
    ReceiveHandler
    This annotation is used for a method that should handle am received Object.
    Synchronized
    This annotation states that an Class is Synchronized and does not do anything inside of other Threads at any point in time if any Method is called.
    Tested
    Shows that a Class is thoroughly tested.
    Testing
    This annotation is used for Tests to show which class is tested.
    Tests
    This Annotation is used to signal multiple different tests for the same Class.

Package com.github.thorbenkuck.netcom2.annotations Description

This package contains all non-rmi annotations.

Most of those annotations are meant for better readability. For example: The Experimental annotation does nothing at Runtime, but signals that the annotated part is not tested correctly.

Those Exceptions might receive annotation-processors (in the future).

The rest of the annotations within this package, are non-specific api annotations (such as ReceiveHandler). Those annotations are considered mandatory for NetCom2.

Since:
1.0
